pageContext.claim: “We've sealed up a lot of the areas where people come in. But they're looking for the soft spots, and they come up in a caravan and they look for the areas without any barrier.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often describes the border as a lawless, unguarded and open. But it is heavily guarded, hundreds of miles are fenced, and the central issue is Central American refugees who are not necessarily trying to cross illegally. Tens of thousands of Central American migrants seeking entry to the United States are presenting themselves at legal ports of entry every year or turning themselves in on purpose to authorities after crossing illegally so they can file asylum claims.
